str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.
Probably from the same as pale; anew, i.e. back, once more, or furthermore or on the other hand.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To come, go.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Cana, a town in Galilee. Of Hebrew origin; Cana, a place in Palestine.
Of Hebrew origin; Galiloea, a region of Palestine.
Where, whither, in what place. From hos and pou; what(-ever) where, i.e. At whichever spot.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Water. And genitive case, hudatos, etc. From the base of huetos; water literally or figuratively.
Wine. A primary word (yayin); 'wine'.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
From basileus; regal, i.e. belonging to the sovereign, or preeminent.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To be weak (physically: then morally), To be sick. From asthenes; to be feeble.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Capernaum, a town of Galilee. Of Hebrew origin; Capernaum, a place in Palestine.
